website_summaries.verdict: Fast transfer speed; easy-to-use plug-and-play formatting. Stands out for compatibility with modern and older devices
pros: Above average speeds with up to 300x write speeds, 90 Mbps transfer
Plug-and-play formatting and self-correcting transfer error technology make it easy to use
Especially good option for use with older and newer devices
cons: Some reports of write and transfer speeds getting slower with frequent use

customer_reviews.title: Item sold is not the item pictured.
customer_reviews.text: The photo posted is not of the card sold. The picturd card has a 60mb/s speed and 400x. The card sold is correctly described in the item details. It is a 45mb/s 300x card. I found this frustrating and misleading. I compared the picture of the product which boasted higher speeds than the actual item to make my selection. I went as far as to return the first item shipped to me because it did not match the image before I discovered the description differed.
customer_reviews.author: N. J. Aponte

customer_reviews.title: about as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I tested this on my computer which has an i7 core and 8 meg ram. I used the H2testw version 1.4 and here is the output. Test finished without errors. You can now delete the test files *.h2w or verify them again. Writing speed: 26.8 MByte/s Reading speed: 62.1 MByte/s H2testw v1.4 The write speed is pretty poor but the read speed is as advertised. The advertised size turns out to be as advertised so it gets 4 stars
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A name brand that I trust, and the stats that I needed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Trascend brand because I already knew the brand and know it is trustworthy. I purchased 16 gigabytes, because I am using these in video cameras where even High Def only consumes about 2gb for about 30 minutes, so I figures 8gb was a little undoing it, and 32gb was way overkill. I also made sure I purchased class 10, 300x speed, not class 4. For video, you want the very best! I purchased 2 full size SD cards and 4 Micro SD cards. I am totally happy and secure that I have long lasting all weather data capture (the larger cards will be used in critter cams) Tom, the Squirrel Whisperer
customer_reviews.author: Tom, the Squirrel Whisper

customer_reviews.title: Good "go-to" SD cards
customer_reviews.text: Transcend cards have seemingly always worked well for me, in cameras, audio recorders, and almost anything else I've shoved them in. I have seldom (maybe never) found a device in which they failed to work. This is not guarantee, of course, but all I can say is that these are my "go-to" cards when I need inexpensive, but good SD cards. I recall buying one years ago that had a problem one day and seemingly locked-up and couldn't be accessed any longer. Before I could complain, I received an email from Amazon noting the problem and advising that there was a recall due to a bad batch. A replacement card arrived days later. Excellent work by Amazon, and by Transcend.
customer_reviews.author: RR - Denver, CO

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I had a camera that required a pretty fast speed of Memory Card (yes, they do come in different speeds!). This one fit the requirement. I have been using it in the camera for over a moth now and can report that it does make a difference! The camera is ready for the next photo in less time. I have always had good success with Transcend products and this memory card did not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Circuits

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a 3DS XL Upgrade.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a sd card to update the memory on my two 3DS XL's, because 4 gb's goes fast. This product works perfectly. While copying data from the included samsung sd card took about ten minuets, transfer of the files onto this wonderful little sd card took only three. My other 3DS XL sd card was a Lexar 4gb, again, ten minutes to transfer to my computer and only three to copy onto my Transcend sd card. Both 3DS's work perfectly with the new sd cards and after witnessing the difference in speed of transfer between the three brands, I am a customer for life! Also, the packaging was extremely easy to open and actually frustration free.
customer_reviews.author: icedsoftball

customer_reviews.title: "Standard Packaging" does not include the standard plastic card protector.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this memory card because I thought since I chose "standard packaging" it would come in the standard plastic memory chip case. It did not. Subsequently, I regret this purchase because I could have ordered any number of others that did some with the simple snap case packaging. It is simple, cheap, standard protection packaging. I can pay $5 and buy a case, but I just as easily could have ordered a different product. I will not order from this company again.
customer_reviews.author: Roo

customer_reviews.title: They work.  They're cheap.  They do fall apart eventually.  Probably won't be a problem for you.
customer_reviews.text: They work well, but after lots of use, they seem to fall apart (literally break in two) before other brands. I work in video production, and I like the price point of Transcend, and the read/write seems just fine. We do use our gear hard, so maybe this is a non-issue for most people, but I have had to throw away more delaminated Transcend cards than the Sony's.
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: Better than it's customer service...
customer_reviews.text: I've now used this for almost two years. The read and write speeds have not deteriorated, despite almost daily use. NB: The product support from Transcend leaves more than a bit to be desired, but that is why we have web search engines. I use it in the slot of my laptop for additional storage, often/repeatedly moving/copying files from one folder to another on different drives.
customer_reviews.author: B B Brown

customer_reviews.title: Works as described.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: It does what it needs to do. Cons: Don't let the label fool you. It doesn't transfer at even close to 45 MB/s. I get anywhere from 5 MB/s to 8 MB/s. This is a card limitation, not my computer. I have a Lexar Professional SD card that is rated at 95 MB/s and I get about 85 MB/s. A full card is going to take 20-30 minutes to transfer everything to your computer. Edit: After trying different card readers I got this working faster. For some reason it's not compatible at higher speeds with some readers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I really like these chips
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this chip again because I recently left a chip in my pocket that ended up being washing & dried with the clothes. Surprisingly, no of the pictures were damaged and the chip is still working. So, I bought two chips and once I arrived, liked how they arrived and I immediately bought two more the same day.
customer_reviews.author: PhotoVid Gallery

customer_reviews.title: Best Bang for the Buck Performance Flash Memory for DSLR camera Owners!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Flash Memory for my Canon DSLR. It is fast enough for continuous recording at 1080p and great for taking pictures fast. Many people reporting issues with their DSLR for video recording and burst shooting - the main reason is because they are not using fast Class 10 memory cards. If the Flash card is not fast enough, it may freeze or lock. I never had an issue with this Flash memory and I highly recommend it for video recording and quick burst shooting for DSLR. It also transfers to your computer pretty fast too. I recommend getting this best bank for the buck flash card for your DSLR camera
customer_reviews.author: Too Nerdy Tech

customer_reviews.title: it's tlc based nand sd card
customer_reviews.text: while transcend has many mlc sd card (start from 600x), this one is tlc based. tlc is not that bad, but for this card, the writing speed is slow (approx. 20MB/s). i have similar price other sd cards that writes much faster. considering it's tlc based, and the cost of production should be low, i think this card doesn't worth that much.
customer_reviews.author: Guest of a guest

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend for casual photographers/videographers
customer_reviews.text: It gets the job done. A class 10 SD card with 16GB of storage is more than enough for what I use it for. I use it to store pictures on my camera. The class 10 speeds is very nice when I decide to record a quick video. If you're a casual photographer with a point and shoot, this SD card is great. the more experienced and serious photographers/videographers will know that a 16GB class 10 will not fit their needs. I have not seen any issues with my SD card yet. All my devices (I have a MacBook and a Windows desktop) have been able to read and write on it with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Was able to use half the card...2nd half all photos/vid's are lost.
customer_reviews.text: Used half the card, downloaded photos/videos and all was fine. 2nd time I went to download, it gave me an error on every computer and with every device I tried to use to download with. Bought this brand once before, that time it worked well. This time, I sadly lost all my pix & videos. I'm told this CAN happen with any brand but it makes me leery to buy this brand again because I've never had an issue with SanDisk or Kingston.
customer_reviews.author: lfpc10

customer_reviews.title: Size is not standard
customer_reviews.text: Read/write speed test results look OK, but the size of this card is a bit larger than standard. I have to push hard to insert it into Canon camera, doesn't hear a click sound as inserting other cards. And it doesn't pop up by pushing again as standard cards, have to pull it out hard using figure or a tool.
customer_reviews.author: HX

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly and available at a good price - no issues so far!
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these, reformatted for FAT32, containing the music library in my car (it has two SD slots for music). These have worked flawlessly, were relatively inexpensive and have been perfect for my application. As a note of reference, I fully tested both cards and transferred full data loads onto and off the cards a few times before installing the cards in my car. These worked perfectly during this phase as well. My car theoretically handles up to 32g cards, but by formatting with "mini tool partition wizard" I was able to format these for FAT32 and the full 64g capacity is available for use in my car stereo.
customer_reviews.author: TechGuy 007

customer_reviews.title: Bad size / fit in camera
customer_reviews.text: These cards are poorly designed. They don't fit correctly without being nudged. Very unhappy but needed them for that day. They worked but didn't fit a D80, D700 correctly and a few cannon slrs also. To late to return but highly disappointed. Flip side, fast shipping!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa McQuown

customer_reviews.title: SDHC card works well in Boss Br-80
customer_reviews.text: works well in Roland/Boss BR-80. Many hours of audio recording. Cheap enough that it can be used as archival media when full. High quality flash memory card, This review is of the Transcend 16gb 300x 10 SDHC card. Package was easy to open, just bend it in the middle and the plastic tray holding the card pops out, Trash the cardboard and save the plastic tray to label the card when it gets full - you can put a much bigger label on the card tray then you can on the card. I will likely purchase more of these as they are handy to keep around. They are the floppy disc of the 21st century.
customer_reviews.author: Huevos RancherosTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Fast and Durable
customer_reviews.text: The card is fast and durable. A great alternative to the San Disk! I try to catch them on sale whenever I can. I use them for my Canon T7i an have no complaints for photos or video.
customer_reviews.author: EL SID

customer_reviews.title: Great Card, But Wireless Data Transfer Beats It By a Mile
customer_reviews.text: I bought this memory card to use with my new video camera, which means that I'm constantly transporting this little disk back-and-forth between my camera and my computer. Yes, this works. Yes, the disk is high quality and holds a LOT of video content. But here's my problem: constantly pulling this card out and popping it into my computer is annoying. It's tedious and annoying. So if you need this card, get it. But if you have the option to go with wireless data transfer, I'd highly recommend it. Moving this disk back-and-forth is just not a good way to spend your time.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer in Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: No lag time on this card! Pic to pic there's no waiting! We bought this Transcend 16 GB High Speed 10 UHC Memory Card for the Nikon camera we bought her for Christmas. In order to get the highest read and writes speeds possible make sure you have a 3.0 card reader - anything less won't deliver the speeds this flash card is capable of, but even w/o it's still FAST! The difference in speed from class 4 to class 10 is incredible and definitely worth the price, and the price on this card was pretty amazing anyway - well worth it! I highly recommend this card!
customer_reviews.author: J.Adams

customer_reviews.title: Solved my camera's video recording buffer issues
customer_reviews.text: For the longest time, I couldn't figure out why my Canon 60D would stop recording a few seconds into my videos when using Class 10 memory cards. I assumed that Class 10 would be fast enough, but apparently there's more to a memory card's speed than the class rating. This card, at 300x and 45 MB/s write speeds, solved the problem. Still, I wish SD card manufacturers would just replace the class rating with something more reliable. If this is faster than most Class 10 cards, why isn't it called Class 12?
customer_reviews.author: Scott Perdue

customer_reviews.title: I have never had a problem with transcends 16GB SDHC cards
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased a few Transcend SDHC Class 10 cards to use with my DSLR and Sony camcorder (Yes I still use a camcorder and I love it). I have not any problems with the cards except that I occasionally misplace them. They have always performed as expected and I don't have any complaints. I would buy again and I can recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!  My pics are sharper and clearer
customer_reviews.text: Awesome...Worked great from the second I put it in my camera. My photos are sharper and the camera feels like it's old self. I can video again without any hesitation or error messages. I didn't want to part with my Nikon coolpix...just adore my camera and thought all was lost...it just needed a new SDHC card. Thanks Amazon...I'm a happy camper again.
customer_reviews.author: Cathie C

customer_reviews.title: It seems like only last week that a 4GB card was awesome
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to keep up with the advances in technology. It seems like only last week that a 4GB card was awesome. I have now installed this in my camera and I'm set for my next long trip with the thousands of photos and videos that I will take. Before I trusted this too much, I tested it fairly rigorously and it passed with flying colors. What more to say - this seems like a 'binary condition' it either does the job or it doesn't. In this case, it does the job and it's a good value.
customer_reviews.author: John S

customer_reviews.title: Works Great, Tons of Memory
customer_reviews.text: My old camera didn't have enough memory for some of the pictures/video I liked to take so when I bought a new camera I was determined to never run out of memory. This is gigantic and I doubt I'll ever run out. I took this on a long trip to Asia and never came close to using its capacity. I've not had any problems with the device, it seems to do everything I would want. If you are purchasing this for an older camera make sure it can handle a chip of this capacity. Some cameras will not be able to work with this.
customer_reviews.author: Frank J.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend. Not a single failure or hiccup with lots of use!
customer_reviews.text: I use these in game cameras. Each on has had literally THOUSANDS of pictures recorded on it and erased from it...with absolutely NO FAILURES. These get rotated from camera to camera, and camera TYPE to camera type. I have several different brands of game cameras alone with three different digital cameras, (various Nikons). Highly recommend. Not a single failure or hiccup!
customer_reviews.author: napitalk

customer_reviews.title: Nice memory card.
customer_reviews.text: Great memory card. I like how quickly it processes the panorama image information so I can get back to shooting pictures or video. This card can hold about 4 hours worth of video and over 4500 16MP stills. (Assuming you pick one or the other, you can mix them up but your mileage varies with what you are storing on the card.) My battery died while shooting a video and I didn't lose any data. NICE!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dad

customer_reviews.title: Works As Described.
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace my last memory stick because I was having trouble with my computer reading it. After checking it out I found the top part was cracked and slightly separated. Not to bad I guess for almost four years of heavy use. So far no problems with my new flash card.. I use a Nikon D5200 with this memory stick and it keeps a lot of pictures on it. So many, that I have a big file to organize once the stick is full. So far, not much more to say. (M. Struse)
customer_reviews.author: William Struse

customer_reviews.title: Good card
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use with my Fuji digital. It works just as expected. The memory size it great for trips as it can hold a large volume even when shooting RAW files. I have had no issues with the card thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: It is good but not as fast as I would like.
customer_reviews.text: I use it as a second card in my camera. It works great but slightly slower than my other card which cost a bit more too.
customer_reviews.author: SandR0ck2003

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and reliable!
customer_reviews.text: I have used the Transcend brand for over four years, taking thousands and thousands of photos and videos without any issues with the cards. I shoot a lot of photos for school events so having a reliable, inexpensive card is essential. While I have worked with SanDisk, Sony, and PNY, the Transcend card is my go-to card for pics and video. It's always great to buy a product that you know is going to provide you with the quality that you need for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: TennisVol

customer_reviews.title: Works with Canon Rebel T3
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I got it I stuck it in my Canon Rebel T3 and formatted it. I don't think this step was necessary but I like to do it anyways before I use a card. I needed a backup card for a wedding I'm shooting and picked this up for the large storage size and great price. I have no issues taking pictures, but I have not tried video yet (that is where SD cards have failed me in the past).
customer_reviews.author: Jessi McPeek

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware, item in picture not actual item.
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware. The description of this item is different than the picture. Actual item is 45mb/s transfer rate while picture to lure you in is 90mb/s. Disappointing
customer_reviews.author: Charles White

customer_reviews.title: Met my expectations, Updated 3-1/2 yrs later.
customer_reviews.text: Installed in my Fuji Finepix S9200 and it performs well. All images are saved fine, videos are fine also. Repeated writing / reading and erasing (over 1200 images) and card is still functioning like new. After 3-1/2 yrs and over 7700 images taken, the card is having a tough time being recognized by the camera. Replaced with a new card purchased at the same time and the new card is being recognized by the camera, so it wasn't the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Editor

customer_reviews.title: sdhc card
customer_reviews.text: have a smaller canon i use these for my husband does anyway.. works great holds lots of pics and i put the settings on raw.. so that makes for smaller amount of pics u can take.. for him this is great
customer_reviews.author: Barbbe

customer_reviews.title: Tons of memory for my video & photo taking needs - buy 2 & I never run out of memory!! )
customer_reviews.text: Been using video on my camera a lot (soccer, tennis, vball, the dog, the family, etc.) - saves a good number of files & quickly so I can get to the next shot quicker. I do delete unwanted files as I go along, so have not run into out of space problems. + I download to my laptop soon after so I can catalogue them right away cuz don't want to mix too many events on the same card. I bought 2 & bring them & use them when I have 2 different events. Lotsa memory for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: sushiray00

customer_reviews.title: Great card
customer_reviews.text: After being frustrated with the transfer speeds of a slower card, I ordered this. I popped it in my camera, and suddenly my it is snapping pictures as fast as I can take them! This is an extremely fast card with ample storage space for a long vacation, extended photo shoot, or even something like a wedding. These things are considered consumable products, so I'll update the day it dies. Until then, if this review hasn't been updated, you can assume it's still working.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Highland

customer_reviews.title: SDs
customer_reviews.text: Bought them for my game cameras. I like the packaging of the SDs. Ive used them before and they work great
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Backup Memory Card for Digital Camera
customer_reviews.text: The Transcend 32 GB high speed flash memory card is great. I originally purchased it as a back up for my point and shoot but it works with everything. It's small enough in size to pack away in the camera case, and writes fast enough that I hardly notice a difference between my other faster card, but has a large enough capacity that even if I forget my main storage card, I never have to worry about running out of space. Very glad I purchased this item as it's come in handy on two trips already where I forgot my main card in the computer downloading the data.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Stores lots of digital images andis fast enough for videos
customer_reviews.text: Stores lots pf pictures in my Lumix and Rebel/ I am a refugee from the film camera days, having retied a Canon F1 and several members of the Leica R series. I miss those, but not the incoventience of finding a way to get the slides processed. I tended to avoid print film...
customer_reviews.author: M. L. Graham

customer_reviews.title: Great SD card
customer_reviews.text: Really reliable SD card for the price. Also, it is class 10 so it is really fast. Would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Zach Hall

customer_reviews.title: GREAT DEAL AND GREAT JOB...................
customer_reviews.text: hello, just a few lines to tell yall that when I ordered the 32GB memory card that such a great price, which was the loses price that I found anywhere around where I live in Louisiana. and anywhere that I looked at on-line. when I saw that price and for a 32GB flash card I could not pass that GREAT DEAL up. and than I got it in the mail in less that 2 weeks, which was really great. great X-MAS gift for myself. thanks so much, and keep up the GREAT DEALS and THE GREAT JOB. thanks once again, toney
customer_reviews.author: toney ortiz

customer_reviews.title: ... this card a year now and it has been great. No issues
customer_reviews.text: Almost had this card a year now and it has been great. No issues. I've got some other brand memory cards lately and I've had corruption issues or complete failure but his card has been perfect... which is important to me as it's being used in my DSLR.
customer_reviews.author: TAS35

customer_reviews.title: This has been a good brand for me!
customer_reviews.text: I personally like the Transcend brand of SD cards, they're often a bargain compared to other brands and, so far, I've never had a failure or lost photos because of one, and I have quite a few at different sizes! I'd bought this card for my Nikon D7000 and it has worked fine since new with many, many photos, and I always reformat the card in the camera after getting the photos all off and backed up. I wouldn't have any problem buying more, and probably will!
customer_reviews.author: JOSEPHTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this a few months ago. I use it pretty heavily with my photography. It gets reformatted often (as that is my habit before going out with camera in hand). Haven't had a problem or a hicup with it. Works great. Arrived with none of that obnoxious-I-need-a-saw-to-open-this plastic packaging, it came in a little easy to open paperboard envelope. Came with a little plastic memory card box.
customer_reviews.author: Kammeron

customer_reviews.title: Works great for photos.
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical at first because of the low price, but this card is great. I use it in my Pentax K-30 and I haven't filled up the card yet, but after a few days of photos, I transfer all the photos to my computer and delete them off my card. I'm still kind of an amateur photographer, so I'm not sure if it's necessarily faster than others or what not. I will testify that it is a great memory card for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Good product!
customer_reviews.text: Works well and has good storage for the pictures that I take. I can do a quick change with the disk and transfer to another device if I need too!
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Wesley

customer_reviews.title: Quality and affordable SD flash memory.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a Sony HD video camera ahead of the holidays. Very fast - quite a bit faster than a smaller capacity 8GB Class 10 SDHC card of another quality brand but I didn't benchmark either card. This isn't quite an apples to apples comparision but I thought it was worth mentioning. Quality card, good capacity and an affordable price. I have purchased several Transcend items the past 4-5 years (SSD, IDE flash memory module, SD cards) and none have ever failed.
customer_reviews.author: slash

customer_reviews.title: Does the job I and my camera require.
customer_reviews.text: This is actually much larger than I needed. But I didn't know that to begin with. It is fast enough to do what new camera needs. And it was very inexpensive. I ended up at a Best Buy with a friend of my who is trying to become a professional photographer in retirement, and he bought a 16 GB, but somewhat faster Memory Card for a few bucks more than I bought this mine.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond W. Kent

customer_reviews.title: Went bad after 10 months, even with limited use.
customer_reviews.text: This card went bad on me after about 10 months. My Panasonic Lumix camera just kept telling me to insert the card again. I even downloaded the Panasonic formatting app in an attempt to reformat the card, but no joy. From now on I will go with SanDisk as I have never had a problem with their cards and they have been long-lasting.
customer_reviews.author: a. audio listener

customer_reviews.title: Check the size
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you check the actual size of the disk. I ordered a 64GB. When I went to format the disk, it only had 28 GB space (so it was probably a 32 GB disk)...despite the label saying 64GB. Thankfully Amazon is replacing this...but check your format size! I almost wouldn't have noticed, except I was making sure pictures were loading properly before I went on vacation (where I will be taking lots of photos).
customer_reviews.author: kls

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Card - Survives Daily Use in a High School for Years!
customer_reviews.text: I am quickly becoming a big fan of Transcend cards. This ones is one of the best values being larger in capacity at a really fair price. Read-write speeds are quick. I teach video production classes and we use Transcend cards in our 10 cameras. They have been used very often by large groups of students for the past 4 years, and we have had zero problems with them whatsoever!
customer_reviews.author: Michael James

customer_reviews.title: Excellent deal and excellent performance
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Transcend thru Amazon for many years for several digital cameras and camcorders in the family. Never a problem. Every time I order at about yearly intervals, the Gigs go up, the speed goes up, and the price per Gig goes down! The price for this 16Gig, Class 10, with the higher speed was less than an 8Gig, Class 10, standard speed of the same brand, Transcend. Excellent deal and excellent performance.
customer_reviews.author: Burney Cain

customer_reviews.title: Error.
customer_reviews.text: Gave me an error after buying in camera. Couldn't see them in the camera but could find them in the computer. Didn't loose the pictures but too risky for using for a paid shoot.
customer_reviews.author: Ana Karina

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to try how memory cards work on my laptop. Yep, nice additional tool for having more space on your laptop, as well as nice insurance for keeping some important files!
customer_reviews.author: Sinisa Miric

customer_reviews.title: won't work
customer_reviews.text: It says card error no matter what I do. I have tried other cards and they work just fine so I know it is not my camera.
customer_reviews.author: amazon1

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Using in a Nintendo 3DS, had to be reformatted to work correctly but this is Nintendo's fault not Transcend's. Haven't run data rate tests, but its been performing well in the 3DS. Transcend makes great flash memory for the price, have and will purchase flash memory based products made by Transcend again.
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: As described
customer_reviews.text: I got this SD card to store music on it for my car sound system. It works as expected, and the price was good.
customer_reviews.author: Beau

customer_reviews.title: Will only purchase Transcend SD cards.
customer_reviews.text: I have always had great service from Transcend SD cards. I probably own 15 or so of various sizes and only had trouble with one that the case had split but his was after having it for a couple years and probably some rough handling. They are in my trail cameras, DSLR and video equipment. I would not hesitate to purchase these SD cards again and again.
customer_reviews.author: Ramblin

customer_reviews.title: Works fine with a 2013 Mercedes SL550.
customer_reviews.text: My 2013 Mercedes SL550 COMMAND infotainment system user manual claims that my ride can only accommodate a 2GB flash memory card. Needing more than just 2GB of data, I purchased this card to see what would happen. (Many Mercedes users have complained that there was a limitation programmed into the COMMAND system that would prevent the user from using a larger memory card.) Turns out this 32GB card works just fine for all my music files. Fast search and play just as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Bruunzweki

customer_reviews.title: A Big Improvement for My Camera
customer_reviews.text: This has been a wonderful purchase for me; I got this for my camera, and it meant upgrading from a 4 gig card to a 32 gig one, a MASSIVE difference that makes taking videos much easier, not to mention pictures; my previous limit for pictures was around 1400 at a time, which I hit once while my computer was down. Now my limit is over 10,000, and I'd have to take a number of large videos to even get it down under that!
customer_reviews.author: David Bythewood

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive And Fast
customer_reviews.text: I've had excellent results using Transcend cards over time. Now I buy only 64GB SDXC cards as they are finally less expensive than two of the 32 GB SDHC ones. I know that Transcend has a faster card than this one, but I don't see a need for this. I'm using this card with a Nikon D600 and it works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: JP KazarianTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: A very good card, typical of the brand
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly, very fast, even for 60P camera and 20MP. Worked perfectly with my Sony RX100 camera. There isn't much I can say other than it did the job and is certainly sufficient for this task. I think it's a bit over the limit and threshold needed, even if demanding, and has proved reliable after several uses. Nothing flashy about the packaging, same as other Transcend cards. If you treat with care it should last.
customer_reviews.author: Joe seo

customer_reviews.title: Great Cards
customer_reviews.text: Decided I rather save photos on memory cards, and at 16GB I know I have more than enough space, and storing these in say a safe box will be safer to me then on the cloud. Bought 2 and I think at this price, will come back for more as memories of esp grand daughter are very precious. I mainly go for the Class 10 cards. These are a very good grade for photos.
customer_reviews.author: Toy Diva

customer_reviews.title: Great Card for you digital camera.
customer_reviews.text: Great memory card. It works well with my cannon EOS Rebal. Pretty much this will hold all the pictures we will take in a year time frame. Then we lock the card and put it in a safe and buy a new one for the next year. I have not had any issues with these cards. There is no issue with the card not keeping up with the camera, to be fair we do not take a lot of pictures in burst mode but when we have it has worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: Todd M

customer_reviews.title: Great card, just make sure you camera can handle 64GB cards
customer_reviews.text: Great price, great SD card. I have the 32GB version of this card and I have really enjoyed it. I haven't had any problems with it at all. But I ordered this 64GB version without realizing that many cameras have a limit to the maximum capacity cards they can work with. I have a $8,000 professional camera and it's limit is 32GB. So just check your camera specs to make sure a 64GB card will work in your camera before ordering it.
customer_reviews.author: jacomstephens

customer_reviews.title: We love our smart Samsung TV
customer_reviews.text: This card doesn't fit into a Samsung camera. I have used several Nikons until I thought I'd try a Samsung camera. We love our smart Samsung TV, so I thought I'd try one of their cameras. Memory card too big. Got another one from Amazon just in time before we headed to Europe for vacation. Amazon refunded my money on this card as soon as we returned to the US, and I notified them of the problem Didn't even have to send the product back, so I gave it away to a kid next door that has a Nikon camera.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Great price, great performance.
customer_reviews.text: I got this on a daily deal, but even at normal price it's an incredible deal. I recently upgraded my DSLR so it made sense to have a faster SD card. I was running a speed 6 and while I haven't noticed much of a difference, I guess I like knowing that I have the best available option, but didn't have to pay a premium price. I've always used SanDisk in the past and had never heard of Transcend so was a bit wary, but no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Janessa L

customer_reviews.title: Transcend 64GB High Speed 10 UHS Flash Memory Card TS64GSDU1E (up to 45 MB/s, 300x)
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a friend of mine who went on a week long trip to an area where there was no way to plug in (Ross Lake, WA), he didn't quite fill it up, but did a fairly good job (52 GB), and killed 7 batteries (1 per day). All the photos and videos came out perfectly, no errors on the memory card, and it handled taking a few HD videos as well with no problems due to bandwidth bottlenecks.
customer_reviews.author: Leavenworth Linux Nut in a Shell

customer_reviews.title: BAD SD card - Into the garbage with you.
customer_reviews.text: Don't bother with this memory card. Burnt out less than a year, after purchase. I got this for my phone, when I got it new. Started acting weird about nine months into the purchase and then it died with all my information on board.
customer_reviews.author: Claw

customer_reviews.title: Totally satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I bought this memory card to use in my Canon T3i digital SLR camera, replacing the Sandisk Ultra 30MB/s card that Best Buy sold me when I bought the camera. With the 30MB/s card the camera would not record video; it exhibited the common "video recording stops automatically" problem. With this 45MB/s card the camera records video flawlessly. Plus the Amazon price was hard to beat :-)
customer_reviews.author: Roger Chaplin

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality product. I ordered two of these and mistakenly ordered the full size cards when I needed micro SD's because of the product description, but these are an excellent product and I recommend them. Have had them before. I ended up ordering their micro SD cards afterwards and was thrilled.
customer_reviews.author: J. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Check your camera
customer_reviews.text: Make sure it fits your camera. I bought 2 for 2 different cameras. It fit one but did not fit the other camera; we found out that camera was too old.I was very satisfied with the camera that it fit and disappointed with the camera did not fit. We were going to Europe, and we were taking a lot of pictures. We did not want to have to delete any pictures. This way we have an extra one for that camera. Seller was prompt.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine Concilio

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this card for awhile and it hasn't failed so quality is fine with the card I received. I'm using the card in my DSLR and haven't had any problems. Price was also reasonable so overall have to give a good rating for value and performance. With ever advancing technology it's getting a bit slow by comparison to newer cards, but if you're doing something like still photography it should be fine.
customer_reviews.author: CrystalTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: I bought this memory card for a dash cam and ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this memory card for a dash cam and the card did not work with the camera. I bought a another card from a local store and had not issues with it in the dash camera.
customer_reviews.author: SnowOwl

customer_reviews.title: My favorite SD card
customer_reviews.text: This memory card is my go-to choice for all of my photography sessions. It's a class 10 card and loads quickly, which I love because I have no patience for slow loading cards. The 16gb card is the perfect size for me. I have bought many of these memory cards and have not had a problem with them yet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: This card fit my parents' Sony Cybershot perfectly. The quality is great and will last a long time because of its large memory capacity. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for Camera Memory!
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my Canon camera and it works great. Lot's of room for pictures and writes them quickly onto the memory.
customer_reviews.author: MustachePanache

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Good price and works with no issue. Use it on my Canon camera.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonBuyer

customer_reviews.title: 16 GB and what do you get?  Another couple thousand pictures and files to boot!
customer_reviews.text: Flash memory is amazing. Transcend has paved the way for affordable flash memory. I use this card in my camera (for photos and video), my computer for holding and transferring files (.pdf, .doc, xls., etc), music from my laptop, desktop, and tablet. It does also allow for capturing video if your camera is able to do so, but not at super fast write speeds. Overall this is a GREAT budget SD card.
customer_reviews.author: J. Sturm

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Card
customer_reviews.text: Swapped out my trusty PNY Professional 16gb Class 10 for this one in my Fuji X-S1, and it was no comparison. Both are fast, but the Transcend cut the rendering times by a 3rd, and the overall feel of the camera is smoother. So far so good. I still have Transcends & PNY's that have outlasted Sandisk and other "top brands" by years....that says it all IMHO.
customer_reviews.author: SmurfTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: As good as Sony
customer_reviews.text: Solid state performance. Works in my Sony camera as well as all three of my Toshiba laptops. Excellent product. Please be aware that some cameras are extra spazzy and you need to allow the camera to format the drive in order to work right. This often means clicking the 'play photos/videos' mode which will make your camera go into format mode automatically without having to go through the whole formatting rigmarole.
customer_reviews.author: A. Cheffy ⭐💖🌛Top Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Fast and reliable
customer_reviews.text: I moved up from a slower card, and the camera (Canon 70D) burst rate and length have increased. I shoot strictly RAW, and each file is 22-25 megabytes at 7 frames a second. It went from buffer full at 9 frames to about 15-17 frames before slowing down. For action shooting, this helps a lot. You will need a USB 3 or Firewire reader to take advantage of the extra speed when transferring files to a hard drive.
customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: Memory is not working !!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item months ago and it wasn't sealed. I didn't surprise when I received it as I thought it's a normal case and I wasn't planning to sell it. Anyway 3 weeks ago, but I surprised that it's not working and after checking I found out that it was used in Sony Camera because there are files for a camera. My advice to check and ensure that the memory is sealed with no scratches. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: As always with Transcend memory - highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: No problems at all. Since I got an 18meg Canon I found the 16gig Transcend cards I have been using for a few years were filling up rather fast, so 2X16 equals 32 gig and I just shoot as usual without concern that I would have to change a card in the middle of an important shoot. The 16gig cards remain in my bag just in case. As always with Transcend memory - highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Bill L.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: No issues at all with this memory card. It works as expected and great value. Is this product worth the money spent on it? Yes Do I like this product? Yes Would I buy this again? Yes Would I recommend this product to family and friends? Yes
customer_reviews.author: Nick Faiello

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a fast, 16 GB SD card.
customer_reviews.text: This 16 GB card works perfectly in my camera. Formats without any problem and reads/writes data without any lag. It's a plus that the listing gives the optimum data transfer rate so you can make an informed purchase decison about cost versus speed. Some others don't give that information, but just advertise as a "Class 10". There are differences. I'm impressed enough that I bought a Ttranscend 32 GB card as well.
customer_reviews.author: Ron N

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What You Would Expect.
customer_reviews.text: Feels nice when holding it. It works extremely as expected. I use it for my T3i to make short films and documentaries. It also works for still photography. 16 gigs will yield about 1 hour of HD videp footage (depending on your camera settings). This is a good addition to my collection.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby SprinklesTop Contributor: Batman

customer_reviews.title: Great card.
customer_reviews.text: Work perfect every time. Never had an issue with the over 30 Transcend cards I have. I use them in everything from DSLR cameras to trail camera that are out in the woods is all types of weather for extended periods of time.
customer_reviews.author: qdmbucks

customer_reviews.title: Transcend, Never a problem and at a Great price, How can you Lose?
customer_reviews.text: I was always a fanatic for SanDisk SDHC cards, but their prices progressively became higher. I decided to try Transcend and no regrets whatsoever. And now that they have the speed to match or even exceed Sandisk in performance and value, thats where my money goes. Both of these brands are great, however, if you want more bang for your buck, Transcend is the way to go. With the savings, you can stock up on 2 for just a little more of what Sandisk cost. Like I said no issues or problems on any of my 6 cameras. Did I mention they're Fantastically Perfect for Video as well?
customer_reviews.author: M. Mercado

customer_reviews.title: Great SD card
customer_reviews.text: I've bought two of these now. I'm using them in a Canon t5i and have been super happy with the speed, quality and price! I average 500-600 pictures a month and they work perfect for me. I've had one for almost a year and recently purchased a second.
customer_reviews.author: Pondering

customer_reviews.title: Oops, look before you leap...
customer_reviews.text: Can't fault the product for my cameras error... Turns out this is NOT compatible with my Canon Vixia HF200 (bought Christmas 2009). I had previously been using a Class 6 and thought 'Bigger is Better', not the case. I'm sure it works great in the right camera, but not for me. Shipping was great as usual, return process just as smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Dragyn509

customer_reviews.title: This 64GB card works great in my new Nikon DX3300
customer_reviews.text: I've bought several Transcend SDXC Class 10 UHS-1 Flash Memory Cards the last few years and they've all worked flawlessly. As my devices keep getting more "data" hungry I keep getting cards with more storage. This 64GB card works great in my new Nikon DX3300. I've recorded video at the highest settings with no issues whatsoever. Highly recommended product.
customer_reviews.author: Music Man

customer_reviews.title: Great "super fast" SD card
customer_reviews.text: You shouldn't buy an storage device slower than this Class 10 card. I don't consider it fast or super fast but it certainly is 20-50x faster than many class 4 or unlabeled devices. The Transcend brand has had the best reliability and long-life for me and is one of the cheapest brands. Buy this card in the largest size you can afford.
customer_reviews.author: TheProfessor

customer_reviews.title: Transcend SD card
customer_reviews.text: These cards work perfectly. I have two and they work very well with my Nikon D3200 camera. They have not become corrupt like some cheap SD cards sold on amazon and they are cheaper in price then Sandisk. I do recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Lester

customer_reviews.title: Works just like it should
customer_reviews.text: This is a fast card SDHC and is perfect for cameras and camcorders. It's overkill for music files really but that what I bought it for. Note that I just bought a Sandisk class 10 card as well and that is definitely slower than this one in write speed. This one wrote my files much quicker than the Sandisk one. No issues reading or writing so far. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding video cards.
customer_reviews.text: I have a good supply of these and I am well pleased with the service that I receive from them. Quick delivery on a very good product. These two came at the right time to video our two church services for Easter Sunday. Thanks, Ben L.
customer_reviews.author: James B. Lineberry

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This Memory work really great. But I have 1 little problem which haven't repeat so far... I shoot in 1920*1080 with my canon 6D 24 frames and ALL-I mode. The problem was some lines side by side like some interference to be honest it looked awful, I shoot 5 times the day I saw that, but only the first video has this problem. As I said, It haven't repeat again, so I'm glad and happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel A.

product_meta.title: Transcend 32GB SDHC Class 10 UHS-1 Flash Memory Card Up to 45MB/s (TS32GSDU1E)
product_meta.description: Capacity:32GB| Package Type:Frustration-Free PackagingCombining the already impressive Class 10 specification with the performance boost of UHS-I, Transcend's Class 10 SDHC Ultra High Speed memory cards help your camera unleash its full potential. When paired with UHS-I compatible devices, these cards offer blazing-fast transfer speeds, perfect for high-speed consecutive shooting and smooth full HD video recording.
feature_bullets: Supports Ultra High Speed Class 1 specification (U1)
Built-in Error Correcting Code (ECC) to detect and correct transfer errors
Supports Content Protection for Recordable Media (CPRM)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars11,238 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
